Contaminated Site Description: The contamination is located on and off the right of way which is in a forested area
Other Regulator Notifed: Ministry of Environment and Parks Ontario
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: Contamination was confirmed on June 18, 2019.  Consultants report will be available in mid July
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Preliminary next steps include a work plan for MP222.33 to include review or report and historical data, groundwater monitoring in July, August and November 2019. Completion of the July groundwater monitoring event will include hydraulic testing and well survey.    We have also submitted the soil samples from the Phase II ESA for PAH analysis, which will be included in the July report. TNPI has requested the consultant to provide work plan for the site including the generation of a RAP, to be reviewed with all stakeholders (MOE and landowners) prior to submission
Annual Update Description Of Changes: Contamination in soil has been achieved delineated, but GW contamination has not yet been delineated. There is shallow bedrock in this area and contamination has penetrated through it. The movement of GW and the connection to contaminant distribution was not clear. In 2021 TNPI did a hydrological study (Feb to May) and quarterly sampling program. The hydrological study consisted of the installation of pressure transducers to continuously log data. The results of the study showed a strong vertical gradient on GW movement, that the GW recharges primarily from infiltration precipitation and some areas of the site have poor hydrology connection. The 2021 GW monitoring showed that most of the GW contamination is on the bedrock and only one GW well with minor contamination at the overburden. No LNAPL was detected.    In 2021/2022 TNPI developed a risk assessment for the site. The recommendations for the risk assessment included further horizontal and vertical delineation for the groundwater,
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: TNPI is proceeding to do additional GW delineation and some surficial soil samples as recommended on the 2021/2022 Risk Assessment report. This activity will take place in Q3/Q4 2022.     TNPI will continue quarterly monitoring of the existing GW wells
